TopicTitle: (NOT COLD FUSION!) The byproducts of BASIC fusion...

Articles.Content: That doesn't really apply, because thorium is almost never found as a pure ore-it's almost all in monazite, which is heavily prospected for, as it contains valuable heavy metals.

I knew thorium was a common waste of rare earth production, but I wasn't aware rare earth ores were a big part of the thorium reserves.

According to wikipedia, thorite is the most common ore of thorium, with 12% content, compared to 2.5% for monazite, but it is mined for its uranium content, so I guess it is prospected for too.
